title: Olivia Jade attends party in LA with boyfriend as her mom Lori Loughlin and dad face legal trouble
text:
Olivia Jade was snapped attending a Beverly Hills, California party with her beau Jackson Guthy Saturday, amid her parents' ongoing legal troubles amid efforts to get her recruited into college.

The 20-year-old social media influencer was clad in a shoulderless white corset top with buttons up the front, with dark grey leather pants and black boots.

The daughter of actress Lori Loughlin and designer Mossimo Giannulli wore multiple necklaces and had her silky brown locks secured in a ponytail, with a black leather purse dangling across her shoulder.

Moving forward: Olivia Jade, 20, was snapped attending a Beverly Hills, California party with her beau Jackson Guthy, 23, on Saturday, amid her parents' ongoing legal troubles amid efforts to get her recruited into college

She held hands with Guthy, who was clad in an all-black ensemble of a long-sleeved shirt over torn jeans and high tops.

Olivia rekindled her romance with Guthy in August after splitting in May. The breakup came in the wake of the surge of publicity after her parents Loughlin, 55, and Giannulli, 56, were indicted by a federal grand jury amid allegations they tried to pay an admissions fixer $500,000 to have Olivia and her older sister Isabella Rose, 21, recruited onto University of Southern California's rowing team in spite of their inexperience in the sport.

'Jackson broke up with Olivia because it was all getting to be too much for him,' a source told US in May. 'It wasn’t necessarily affecting his career, but the fact that he couldn’t be seen out in public with Olivia was difficult.'

Among the stars in attendance at the bash - which was to commemorate musician/producer Andrew Watt‘s birthday - included Maroon 5's Adam Levine and wife Behati Prinsloo, Jared Leto and Justin and Hailey Bieber.

Reunited: Olivia rekindled her romance with Guthy in August after splitting in May

Tough time: Loughlin, 55, and Giannulli, 56, were snapped at a Boston federal court in April

The Full House actress and her husband have pleaded not guilty, and will return to court next year in the case.

Last week, Oscar-nominated actress actress Felicity Huffman began her two-week prison sentence at the Federal Correctional Institution, Dublin, located near San Francisco following her guilty plea to mail fraud and honest services mail fraud charges in the scandal.

Loughlin reached out to Huffman, according to People, 'to encourage her, and see how she was doing,' a source told the magazine. 'She feels like their fates are tied together now, even though they weren’t really friends before.'

The source said Loughlin 'wants to debrief Felicity after jail to find out what it was like and what her advice would be,' as 'she feels like Felicity’s time in jail will be an indicator on her own time, and she’s extremely curious to know how it goes.'
description: The daughter of actress Lori Loughlin and designer Mossimo Giannulli had her silky brown locks secured in a ponytail, with a black leather purse dangling across her shoulder.
